required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Immunoglobulin Intravenous (Human) 10% (NewGam) in Primary Immune Thrombocytopenia
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Open-label, Non-controlled, Multicenter, Phase III Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Immunoglobulin Intravenous (Human) 10% (NewGam) in Primary Immune Thrombocytopenia

brief_summary.textblock: NewGam is a newly developed human normal immunoglobulin solution for intravenous administration (IGIV). This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of NewGam 10% in patients with primary immune thrombocytopenia.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to assess the efficacy of NewGam in correcting the platelet count. The secondary objective of the study is to evaluate the safety of NewGam. Safety will be assessed by monitoring vital signs, physical examination, evaluation of adverse events (AE) and laboratory parameters, and viral safety testing.

primary_outcome.description: A responder is a study participant with an increase in platelets to ≥ 50x10^9/L within 7 days after the first infusion, ie, by study Day 8.

secondary_outcome.description: An alternative responder is a study participant with an increase in platelets to ≥ 30x10^9/L and to at least double the baseline platelet count, confirmed on at least 2 occasions at least 7 days apart, and absence of bleeding.
A complete responder is a study participant with an increase in platelets to ≥ 100x10^9/L, confirmed on at least 2 occasions at least 7 days apart, and absence of bleeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Alternative Responders Who Lost the Response
secondary_outcome.description: An alternative responder who lost the response is a study participant who met the criterion for an alternative response but who then deteriorated, ie, their platelet count decreased to < 30x10^9/L, their platelet count decreased to less than double the baseline count, or bleeding occurred.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Complete Responders Who Lost the Response
secondary_outcome.description: A complete responder who lost the response is a study participant who met the criterion for a complete response but who then deteriorated, ie, their platelet count decreased to < 100x10^9/L or bleeding occurred.
A study participant had a response if their platelets increased to ≥ 50x10^9/L within 7 days after the first infusion, ie, by study Day 8.

A study participant had a response if their platelets increased to ≥ 30x10^9/L and to at least double the baseline platelet count, confirmed on at least 2 occasions at least 7 days apart, and absence of bleeding.
A study participant had a complete response if their platelets increased to ≥ 100x10^9/L, confirmed on at least 2 occasions at least 7 days apart, and absence of bleeding.
The duration of a response was defined as the time from when a response was achieved until the platelet count fell below 50x10^9/L.
The duration of an alternative response was defined as the time from when an alternative response was achieved until the platelet count fell below 50x10^9/L.
The duration of a complete response was defined as the time from when a complete response was achieved until the platelet count fell below 50x10^9/L.
The platelet count at each study visit are presented.
The maximum platelet count achieved during the study is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Responders Who Achieved a Normal Platelet Count
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of responders who achieved a normal platelet count is presented.

The percentage of participants with various intensities of overall bleeding, epistaxis (bleeding of the nose), oral bleeding, and skin bleeding graded as none, minor, mild, moderate, or severe at Baseline and Day 22 are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Platelet Count > 30x10^9/L
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who achieved a platelet count > 30x10^9/L within 1 and 2 days after infusion is reported.

arm_group.description: Each participant received 1 g/kg NewGam intravenously on 2 consecutive days.

intervention.description: NewGam is a solution of human normal immunoglobulin 10% treated with solvent/detergent and nanofiltered for intravenous administration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age of ≥ 18 and ≤ 65 years.
2. Confirmed diagnosis of chronic primary immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) (diagnosed with a threshold platelet count < 100x10^9/L) of at least 12 months duration.
3. Platelet count of no more than 20x10^9/L with or without bleeding manifestations.
4. Freely given written informed consent from patient.
5. Women of childbearing potential must have a negative result on a pregnancy test (human chorionic gonadotropin [HCG]-based assay) and need to practice contraception using a method of proven reliability for the duration of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Thrombocytopenia secondary to other diseases (such as acquired immunodeficiency syndrome [AIDS] or systemic lupus erythematosus [SLE]), or drug-related thrombocytopenia.
2. Administration of intravenous immunoglobulin (IGIV), anti-D immunoglobulin or thrombopoietin receptor agonists, or other platelet enhancing drugs (including immunosuppressive or other immunomodulatory drugs) within 3 weeks before enrollment, except for:
- Long-term corticosteroid therapy when the dose has been stable during the preceding 3 weeks and no dosage change is planned until study Day 22.
- Long-term azathioprine, cyclophosphamide, or attenuated androgen therapy when the dose has been stable during the preceding 3 months and no dosage change is planned until study Day 22.
3. Unresponsive to previous treatment with IGIV or anti-D immunoglobulin.

overall_official.affiliation: Universitätsklinikum Charite, Med. Fakultät der Humboldt-Universität Berlin

group.title: NewGam
group.description: Each participant received 1 g/kg NewGam intravenously on 2 consecutive days.

baseline.population: Safety set: All participants enrolled in the study who received at least part of 1 dose of NewGam.

outcome.title: Percentage of Responders
outcome.description: A responder is a study participant with an increase in platelets to ≥ 50x10^9/L within 7 days after the first infusion, ie, by study Day 8.
outcome.population: Full analysis set: All participants enrolled in the study who received at least part of 1 dose of NewGam and who had at least 1 post-baseline measurement of platelet concentration.

outcome.description: An alternative responder who lost the response is a study participant who met the criterion for an alternative response but who then deteriorated, ie, their platelet count decreased to < 30x10^9/L, their platelet count decreased to less than double the baseline count, or bleeding occurred.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Michael Eppolito, Director, Clinical Operations Immunology and ICU Medicine
